column4: anyone know why a drive mounted to /media/video  would show only 50m available when the drive itself has atleast 8g?
DVB-S the "official guestimate" is 2GB per 1 hour, so 50m might suggest that the filesystem has a 2GB limit? *wonder*
gnome file explorer (or whatever) is reading it's properties as having 50, the partition tool (and my own memory of partitioning it) is where the 8 gig come from
something like that, brand new install, nothing on the dirve
hmm the drive in question isn't even showing up
there are a number of issues here.
. .it's saying that it's not in fstab, but i'm looking at it right now
so what do i need to be doing?
what to you want to do?
i want the drive to automount to the mountpoint
ok found the issue, just a quick question, now that my fstab is correct, it will automount?
